input: In the event of a Cyber Incident under Section 14 of the Private Car Long Term Package Policy, coverage is provided against malicious acts or malware on Insured's personal devices during the Policy Period. This coverage includes protection against unauthorized access, data theft, and other cyber-related losses. The policy provides a limited amount of coverage for expenses incurred in responding to and remedying the incident, as well as any resulting losses.
actual_output: Yes, according to Section 14 of the Private Car Long Term Package Policy, the coverage provided includes protection against malicious acts or malware on Insured's personal devices during the Policy Period. This means that if the policyholder experiences a Cyber Incident, they will be covered for expenses incurred in responding to and remedying the incident, as well as any resulting losses.
expected_output: Coverage is provided against malicious acts or malware on Insured's personal devices during the Policy Period, including protection against unauthorized access, data theft, and other cyber-related losses.

context:
SBI General Insurance Company Limited
Whereas the Insured by a proposal and declaration dated as stated in 
the Schedule which shall be the basis of this contract and is deemed 
to be incorporated herein has applied to SBI GENERAL INSURANCE 
COMPANY LIMITED (hereinafter called “the Company”) for the 
insurance hereinafter contained and has paid the premium 
mentioned in the Schedule as consideration for such Insurance to the 
Company and which has been realized by the Company in respect of 
accidental loss or damage occurring during the Policy Period as 
stated in the schedule.
The term private car shall include Private Car Type Vehicles used for 
social, domestic and pleasure purposes and also for professional 
purposes (excluding the carriage of goods other than samples) of the 
insured or used by the insured's employees for such purposes but 
excluding use for hire or reward, racing, pace making, reliability trial, speed 
testing and use for any purpose in connection with the Motor Trade.
NOW THIS POLICY WITNESSETH:
That subject to the terms, exceptions and conditions contained 
herein or endorsed or expressed hereon;
1. Act means the Insurance Act, 1938 (4 of 1938).
2. Authority means the Insurance Regulatory and Development 
Authority of India established under the provisions of section 3 
of  the Insurance Regulatory and Development Authority Act, 
1999 (41 of 1999).
3. Battery Electric Vehicle is a pure/ only or Electric Vehicle, that 
exclusively uses chemical energy stored in rechargeable battery 
packs, with no secondary source of propulsion (Eg: Hydrogen 
fuel cells, internal combustion etc.) Battery Electric vehicle 
derive all power from battery packs and thus have no internal 
combustion engine/fuel tank.
4. Constructive Total Loss - The vehicle be considered to be 
Constructive Total Loss (CTL), where aggregate cost of 
retrieval and/ or repair of the vehicle subject to terms and 
conditions of the Policy exceed 75% of the Sum Insured.
5. Carry Forward means the limit that has been made available 
from the expired Policy of the Insured with the Company.
6. Cyber Incident means any malicious act or malware occurring 
on Insured's personal devices.
7. Competent Authority means
 I. Chairperson, or
 II. such whole-time member or such committee of the whole-
time members or such officer(s) of the Authority, as may be 
determined by the Chairperson.
8. Complaint or  Grievance means written expression (includes 
communication in the form of electronic mail or voice based 
electronic scripts) of dissatisfaction by a complainant with 
respect to solicitation or sale or purchase of an insurance policy 
or related services by insurer and /or by distribution channel.
 Explanation: An inquiry or service request would not fall within 
the definition of the “complaint” or “grievance”.
9. Complainant means a policyholder or prospect or nominee or 
assignee or any beneficiary of an insurance policy who has filed a 
complaint or grievance against an insurer and /or distribution 
channel.
DEFINITIONS 
10. Cover means an insurance contract whether in the form of a 
policy document or a cover note or a Certificate of Insurance or 
any other form as may be specified to evidence the existence of 
an insurance contract.
11. Data means any digital information, irrespective of the way it is 
used, stored, or displayed (such as text, figures, images, video, 
recordings, or software).
12. Distribution Channels include insurance agents, intermediaries 
or insurance intermediaries, and any persons or entities 
authorised by the Authority to involve in sale and service of 
insurance policies.
13. Electric Vehicle is a vehicle that uses one or more electric 
motors for propulsion, it can be powered by a collector system 
with electricity from extra vehicular sources, or it can be 
powered autonomously by a battery. Sometimes charged by 
solar panels, or by converting fuel to electricity using fuel cells or 
a generator. Electric Vehicle means, either Battery Electric 
Vehicle or Hybrid Electric Vehicle. 
 Explanation:
 (i)  “Material Information” for the purpose of these regulations 
shall mean all important, essential and relevant information 
and documents explicitly sought by insurer in the proposal 
form.
 (ii)  The requirements of “disclosure of material information” 
regarding a proposal or policy, apply both to the insurer and 
the prospect, under these regulations.
 Explanation:

Insurance product referred herein shall also 
include the riders or add-on(s), if any Where a rider or add-on is 
tied to a base policy, all the terms and conditions of the rider or 
add-on shall be mentioned in the prospectus. Where a 
standalone rider or add-on is offered to a base product, a 
reference to the rider or add-on shall be made in the prospectus 
of the base policy indicating the nature of benefits flowing 
thereupon.
14. Grace Period means the number of days available with the 
Insured to opt for Top Up after the expiry of the opted 
kilometers at the time of inception of the Policy or last Top Up, 
during the Policy Period/Year.
15. Hybrid Electric Vehicle is powered by an internal combustion by 
one or more electric motors, which uses energy stored in the 
batteries. A hybrid electric vehicle cannot be plugged in to 
charge the battery. Instead, the battery is charged through 
regenerative break-in and by the internal combustion engine.
16. Home-maker shall also be incapacitated to perform Normal 
Domestic duties and the student shall also be incapacitated to 
perform Normal Activity of a student. 
17. Lost or Stolen - means having being inadvertently lost or having 
been stolen by a third  party without Insured's assistance, 
consent or co-operation.
18. Loss with regard to: 
 a) toe, finger, thumb means actual complete severance from 
the foot or hand; 
 b) hearing means entire and irrecoverable loss of hearing. 
19. Malware means any unauthorised or illegal Software or code 
(such as viruses, spyware, computer worms, trojan horses, 
POLICY WORDING
PRIVATE CAR LONG TERM PACKAGE POLICY
SBI General Insurance Company Limited,    Corporate & Registered Office: Fulcrum Building, 9th Floor, A & B Wing, Sahar Road, Andheri (East), Mumbai - 400099. | CIN: 
U66000MH2009PLC190546 |    Tollfree: 18001021111 |     customer.care@sbigeneral.in |     www.sbigeneral.in | SBI Logo displayed belongs to State Bank of India and 
used by SBI General Insurance Company Limited under license. | IRDAI Reg No: 144 | Private Car Long Term Package Policy, UIN: IRDAN144RPMT0022V01202425 | SBI 
General Insurance and SBI are separate legal entities and SBI is working as Corporate Agent of the company for sourcing of insurance products.
PREAMBLE

input: Riders and add-ons tied to the base policy comply with disclosure requirements as stated in the prospectus by mentioning the nature of benefits flowing thereupon in the prospectus of the base policy.
actual_output: Yes, riders and add-ons tied to the base policy comply with the disclosure requirements stated in the prospectus. The prospectus must mention the nature of benefits flowing thereupon for any rider or add-on tied to the base policy.
expected_output: Riders and add-ons comply with disclosure requirements.

input: Is SBI General Insurance Company Limited authorized to sell insurance policies by IRDAI?
actual_output:
Yes, according to the provided context, SBI General Insurance Company Limited is authorized to sell insurance policies. The context states "SBI General Insurance Company Limited,    Corporate & Registered Office: Fulcrum Building, 9th Floor, A & B Wing, Sahar Road, Andheri (East), Mumbai - 400099." 

It also mentions IRDAI Reg No: 144 which indicates that it is registered with the Insurance Regulatory and Development Authority of India (IRDAI).
expected_output: Yes, SBI General Insurance Company Limited is authorized to sell insurance policies by IRDAI as it has obtained the necessary license and registration.

input: Investigate the role of hybrid electric vehicles in expanding rural India’s access to healthcare services and markets, exploring how this can positively impact economic growth and development in these regions.
actual_output:
Unfortunately, the provided context does not mention anything about the role of hybrid electric vehicles in expanding rural India's access to healthcare services and markets, or its potential impact on economic growth and development.

The context appears to be a policy document related to motor insurance, discussing definitions, terms, conditions, and explanations for various types of vehicles, including Electric Vehicles (EVs) and Hybrid EVs. There is no mention of rural India's access to healthcare services, markets, or economic growth.

Therefore, I cannot provide an answer based on the provided context. If you'd like to share more information or clarify what specific aspect of hybrid electric vehicles you're interested in exploring, I'd be happy to help.
expected_output: The role of hybrid electric vehicles in expanding rural India's access to healthcare services and markets is not explicitly mentioned in the provided policy document. However, as Hybrid Electric Vehicles are powered by an internal combustion engine and one or more electric motors, they can potentially be used for medical transportation purposes. This could help bridge the gap in healthcare services in rural areas, contributing positively to economic growth and development in these regions.

NOW THIS POLICY WITNESSETH:
That subject to the terms, exceptions and conditions contained 
herein or endorsed or expressed hereon;
1. Act means the Insurance Act, 1938 (4 of 1938).
2. Authority means the Insurance Regulatory and Development 
Authority of India established under the provisions of section 3 
of  the Insurance Regulatory and Development Authority Act, 
1999 (41 of 1999).
3. Battery Electric Vehicle is a pure/ only or Electric Vehicle, that 
exclusively uses chemical energy stored in rechargeable battery 
packs, with no secondary source of propulsion (Eg: Hydrogen 
fuel cells, internal combustion etc.) Battery Electric vehicle 
derive all power from battery packs and thus have no internal 
combustion engine/fuel tank.
4. Constructive Total Loss - The vehicle be considered to be 
Constructive Total Loss (CTL), where aggregate cost of 
retrieval and/ or repair of the vehicle subject to terms and 
conditions of the Policy exceed 75% of the Sum Insured.
5. Carry Forward means the limit that has been made available 
from the expired Policy of the Insured with the Company.
6. Cyber Incident means any malicious act or malware occurring 
on Insured's personal devices.
7. Competent Authority means
 I. Chairperson, or
 II. such whole-time member or such committee of the whole-
time members or such officer(s) of the Authority, as may be 
determined by the Chairperson.
8. Complaint or  Grievance means written expression (includes 
communication in the form of electronic mail or voice based 
electronic scripts) of dissatisfaction by a complainant with 
respect to solicitation or sale or purchase of an insurance policy 
or related services by insurer and /or by distribution channel.
 Explanation: An inquiry or service request would not fall within 
the definition of the “complaint” or “grievance”.
9. Complainant means a policyholder or prospect or nominee or 
assignee or any beneficiary of an insurance policy who has filed a 
complaint or grievance against an insurer and /or distribution 
channel.
DEFINITIONS 
10. Cover means an insurance contract whether in the form of a 
policy document or a cover note or a Certificate of Insurance or 
any other form as may be specified to evidence the existence of 
an insurance contract.
11. Data means any digital information, irrespective of the way it is 
used, stored, or displayed (such as text, figures, images, video, 
recordings, or software).
12. Distribution Channels include insurance agents, intermediaries 
or insurance intermediaries, and any persons or entities 
authorised by the Authority to involve in sale and service of 
insurance policies.
13. Electric Vehicle is a vehicle that uses one or more electric 
motors for propulsion, it can be powered by a collector system 
with electricity from extra vehicular sources, or it can be 
powered autonomously by a battery. Sometimes charged by 
solar panels, or by converting fuel to electricity using fuel cells or 
a generator. Electric Vehicle means, either Battery Electric 
Vehicle or Hybrid Electric Vehicle.

 (i)  “Material Information” for the purpose of these regulations 
shall mean all important, essential and relevant information 
and documents explicitly sought by insurer in the proposal 
form.
 (ii)  The requirements of “disclosure of material information” 
regarding a proposal or policy, apply both to the insurer and 
the prospect, under these regulations.

input: How robust data protection protocols can mitigate potential losses for Insured's personal devices from AI-powered security software in safeguarding against cyber threats, considering the definition of Cyber Incident (section 6) and Data (section 11), is that implementing encryption, secure update mechanisms, and regular backups with secure storage, will enhance overall security measures, thereby reducing potential data breaches.
actual_output:
Based on the provided context, the answer to the question is: Not explicitly stated.

While the policy document discusses Cyber Incident and Data, it does not directly address how robust data protection protocols can mitigate potential losses for Insured's personal devices from AI-powered security software in safeguarding against cyber threats. The document only mentions the definition of Cyber Incident (section 6) and Data (section 11), but does not provide guidance on implementing encryption, secure update mechanisms, or regular backups with secure storage to enhance overall security measures.

Therefore, the answer is that this information is not explicitly stated in the policy document provided.
expected_output: The implemented data protection protocols can mitigate potential losses for Insured's personal devices by encrypting data, ensuring secure updates and regular backups with secure storage.

input: Explain how the combined financial impact of damage exceeds 75% of the vehicle's insured value in a Constructive Total Loss situation.
actual_output:
According to the provided context, a Constructive Total Loss (CTL) occurs when the aggregate cost of retrieval and/or repair of the vehicle subject to the terms and conditions of the Policy exceeds 75% of the Sum Insured.

To explain how the combined financial impact of damage exceeds 75% of the vehicle's insured value in a CTL situation:

Let's say the vehicle has an insured value of ₹10,000 (the Sum Insured).

In a CTL situation, if the total cost of repair is ₹7,500 and the retrieval costs are ₹3,000, the aggregate cost would be ₹10,500.

Since ₹10,500 exceeds 75% of ₹10,000 (£10,000 x 0.75 = ₹7,500), the vehicle would be considered a Constructive Total Loss (CTL).
expected_output: The combined financial impact of damage exceeding 75% of the vehicle's insured value in a Constructive Total Loss situation means that the cost of retrieval and/or repair exceeds 75% of the Sum Insured.

7. Competent Authority means
 I. Chairperson, or
 II. such whole-time member or such committee of the whole-
time members or such officer(s) of the Authority, as may be 
determined by the Chairperson.
8. Complaint or  Grievance means written expression (includes 
communication in the form of electronic mail or voice based 
electronic scripts) of dissatisfaction by a complainant with 
respect to solicitation or sale or purchase of an insurance policy 
or related services by insurer and /or by distribution channel.
 Explanation: An inquiry or service request would not fall within 
the definition of the “complaint” or “grievance”.
9. Complainant means a policyholder or prospect or nominee or 
assignee or any beneficiary of an insurance policy who has filed a 
complaint or grievance against an insurer and /or distribution 
channel.
DEFINITIONS 
10. Cover means an insurance contract whether in the form of a 
policy document or a cover note or a Certificate of Insurance or 
any other form as may be specified to evidence the existence of 
an insurance contract.
11. Data means any digital information, irrespective of the way it is 
used, stored, or displayed (such as text, figures, images, video, 
recordings, or software).
12. Distribution Channels include insurance agents, intermediaries 
or insurance intermediaries, and any persons or entities 
authorised by the Authority to involve in sale and service of 
insurance policies.
13. Electric Vehicle is a vehicle that uses one or more electric 
motors for propulsion, it can be powered by a collector system 
with electricity from extra vehicular sources, or it can be 
powered autonomously by a battery. Sometimes charged by 
solar panels, or by converting fuel to electricity using fuel cells or 
a generator. Electric Vehicle means, either Battery Electric 
Vehicle or Hybrid Electric Vehicle. 
 Explanation:
 (i)  “Material Information” for the purpose of these regulations 
shall mean all important, essential and relevant information 
and documents explicitly sought by insurer in the proposal 
form.
 (ii)  The requirements of “disclosure of material information” 
regarding a proposal or policy, apply both to the insurer and 
the prospect, under these regulations.
 Explanation:
